channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump's Germany troops pullout may be his last gift to Putin before the election
item.description: Since he came to office, US President Donald Trump has obsessively picked at the ties that bind America to its allies.

item.title: Hear why experts now question if masks are enough
item.description: Public health officials have been stressing the importance of wearing face masks to slow the spread of the coronavirus for months, but many experts are now urging the use of face shields and eye goggles as well. CNN's Brian Todd reports.

item.title: Delta flight returns to gate after travelers refuse to wear masks
Australia imposes curfew in second-largest city
item.description: The premier of Victoria plunged Australia's second-largest state into a "state of disaster" on Sunday, announcing even stricter lockdown measures, introducing a nightly curfew and banning virtually all trips outdoors after the region announced 671 new infections in a single day.

item.title: For the first time, media banned from Republican convention
How 'good White people' delay racial progress
Dr. Fauci and Jim Jordan get in heated exchange over protests
item.description: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) gets in a fiery exchange with Dr. Anthony Fauci over whether protests should be limited in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: 'Rock star' WHO leader is stuck between feuding China and US
item.description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus was watching late-night television when he saw a hospital boss criticizing him and Ethiopia's Health Ministry, which he was leading at the time, for doing a terrible job. Instead of responding with a furious diatribe, as some political leaders might when watching their detractors on TV, he contacted the man, Dr. Kesete Admasu.

item.title: This doctor just endured the deadliest week of his career
Connie Culp, the first person to receive a near-total face transplant in the US, has died
item.description: Connie Culp, the first person in the US to receive a near-total face transplant, has died, according to the Cleveland Clinic, where the procedure was performed in 2008. She was 57 years old.

item.title: TikTok users are freaking out over possible US ban
item.description: Late Friday night, a social platform best known for coordinated dance routines and funny videos turned somber. TikTok users across the US began livestreaming and posting videos in tribute to what they feared was the end of TikTok, the short-form video app they've come to love and depend on.

item.title: Joe Biden narrows down his VP list, and a candidate emerges
item.description: Joe Biden heads into the weekend weighing the biggest decision of his presidential campaign so far, and people close to the process tell CNN that the former vice president is believed to have now begun to narrow his personal shortlist of potential running mates to a handful of women.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
NASA-SpaceX mission: Astronauts prepare to board Crew Dragon from the ISS
item.description: NASA astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley are preparing to leave the International Space Station this evening and begin their 19-hour journey home, capping off the their historic mission aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft.

item.title: 20,000 more Americans could die from Covid-19 in the next 21 days, CDC ensemble forecast shows
item.description: The US has reported more deaths linked to coronavirus than anywhere else in the world and updated models show 20,000 more Americans could die in just the next three weeks.

item.title: Do some people have protection against the coronavirus?
item.description: We're now more than seven months into the coronavirus pandemic that has upended the lives of most of Earth's inhabitants. And while it is true that the scientific community has learned many things about the SARS-CoV-2 virus and the disease it causes, Covid-19, there are also many gaps in our understanding.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios pulls out of US Open amid coronavirus concerns
item.description: Tennis star Nick Kyrgios has announced that he will not play at the upcoming US Open due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: When the US might expect to get a Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: CNN's Elizabeth Cohen talks to Dr. Moncef Slaoui, chief adviser to "Operation Warp Speed," the federal government's Covid-19 vaccine program, about when Americans can expect a vaccine to be available and how effective it could be.

item.title: Rosa Parks's handwritten letter about Martin Luther King Jr. goes up for sale
item.description: A letter that Rosa Parks wrote in remembrance of Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. nearly a decade after his death is up for sale.

item.title: 'Cocoon' star Wilford Brimley dies at 85
item.description: Wilford Brimley, the mustachioed actor who appeared on the big screen, television shows and Quaker Oats commercials, has died. He was 85.

item.title: It's the 'Sweat' you drink. And it's loved in Asia
The latest twist in the story of how this painting went from $10K to $450M
item.description: A new retelling of the drama and mystery surrounding the world's most expensive painting is set to take the stage in New York in 2022 as a major Broadway musical.

item.title: Hong Kong is setting up a postponed election without a real opposition
Why Greece could be Europe's best holiday ticket right now
item.description: If you're wondering how coronavirus has affected that Greece vacation dream of blue skies, bluer seas, bright sunshine and the most delicious al fresco salad you've ever tasted -- it hasn't.

item.title: See the 'space butterfly' astronomers captured from thousands of light years away
item.description: Thousands of light years away, there's a "space butterfly" colored with brilliant blues and clouds of purple and red. It's an image we've never seen in this much detail before.

item.title: Tie-dye on the rise as a pandemic pastime
item.description: For Danielle Somers, tie-dye has taken on ritual status during the pandemic.

item.title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang brace helps Arsenal lift the FA Cup against Chelsea
item.description: Arsenal came from behind to claim the FA Cup with a 2-1 victory against Chelsea thanks to a Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang double at Wembley Stadium.

item.title: Why celebrities are backing this baseless US conspiracy theory
item.description: A baseless claim about a child sex-trafficking ring, a Washington, DC pizzeria, and Hillary Clinton has been passed around among conspiracy theorists for more than three years. No evidence has emerged to support any part of the story. But last month, British pop star Robbie Williams used his voice to argue that the claims deserved more attention.

item.title: Isaias downgraded to tropical storm as it approaches Florida coast
item.description: Florida is now beginning to feel the first effects of a powerful storm system that is inching slowly in the state's direction.

item.title: California firefighters brace for raging flames and a burgeoning pandemic
item.description: With temperatures soaring and winds gusting, California firefighters may soon face their first significant battle against wildland blazes, but they will also have to contend with the uncertain terrain caused by the coronavirus.

item.title: In Italy, masks have become a fashion statement not a political statement
item.description: CNN's Barbie Latza Nadeau reports from Rome on how Italians are attempting to prevent a second wave of coronavirus infections by wearing masks.

item.title: Plane overloaded with cocaine crashes on take-off, exposing alleged crime syndicate
item.description: A light aircraft overloaded with cocaine crashed on take-off on its way to Australia, police said on Saturday, exposing a Melbourne-based crime syndicate and leading to the arrest of five men with alleged links to the Italian mafia.

item.title: Fact checking Trump's claim that he is tough on Russia
item.description: Despite his claim that he is tough on Russia, President Donald Trump says he has not discussed US intelligence reports accusing Russia of offering bounties to Taliban fighters to kill US troops with President Vladimir Putin. CNN's Brianna Keilar breaks down 37 times Trump was soft on Russia.

item.title: See the Nike ad everyone's talking about
item.description: Nike's latest ad sends a powerful message about Covid-19 and the Black Lives Matter movement. At a time when professional sports are struggling to start up amidst the pandemic, the ad has quickly become popular online.

item.title: Virus reunites long-lost sisters who haven't seen each other in over 50 years
item.description: Two Nebraska sisters who were separated 53 years ago are now reunited thanks to the coronavirus.

item.title: Emirati woman smashes soccer 'hotstepping' Guinness record
item.description: Areej Al Hammadi, a young woman from the United Arab Emirates, has shattered the Guinness World Record for soccer ball "hotstepping," completing 86 repetitions of the ball control trick in a minute.

item.title: How Ethiopian art secured its spot on the world's stage
item.description: Over the last five years contemporary Ethiopian artists have been making a name for themselves on the global art market, but it's been a long time coming.

item.title: How Toblerone chocolate became connected with air travel
item.description: Toblerone may not be the most famous chocolate brand in the world, but it's arguably the most iconic -- especially when it comes to travel.

item.title: Bizarre sculpture unveiled in the heart of London
item.description: A giant swirl of whipped cream topped with a cherry, a fly and a drone has become the latest artwork to sit atop Trafalgar Square's Fourth Plinth -- the stage for a constantly changing series of artworks.

item.title: Stunning photos of the world's remotest tribes
item.description: In 2013, the British photographer Jimmy Nelson published his first monograph, a 400-page photo book titled "Before They Pass Away." His subjects were shot in some of the world's most remote wildernesses, showing us, in monumental fashion, the lives and cultures of some of the world's most isolated and ancient indigenous communities.

item.title: The art world has a money laundering problem
item.description: Shell companies with hidden owners. Middlemen who shield the identities of buyers and sellers. Inadequate safeguards to keep out shady money.

item.title: This uniquely Hong Kong snack is popping up around the world
item.description: When I decided to write a story about the origins of Hong Kong bubble waffles -- also known as "egg waffles" -- I thought it would be easy.

item.title: What we've gotten wrong about how sperm move
item.description: Using complex mathematics and 3D imaging, a group of researchers at the University of Bristol have discovered human sperm doesn't move the way we have believed for centuries

item.title: Dirty tricks and the 2020 election: lessons from the KGB
item.description: Feeding incendiary documents to news outlets. Infiltrating activist groups. Sowing division and confusion. It might sound like a recap of Russia's efforts to meddle in the 2016 US election, but some of these same tactics were laid bare in a CNN television report on Soviet disinformation efforts back in 1983.

item.title: For the first time, media banned from Republican convention
item.description: • Thousands gather in Berlin to protest Covid-19 restrictions • LIVE: Australia imposes curfew in second-largest city

item.title: 'Nobody likes me,' Trump complains, as his allies fade
item.description: Lamenting his plunging popularity this week, a self-pitying President Donald Trump wondered how it all went wrong.

item.title: Trump's trashing of democracy will have consequences far beyond America
item.description: When you are President of the United States, your words matter. Not just to your own voters, not just to your own citizens, but to people in every corner of the planet.

item.title: CNN analyst: This is the latest sign that Trump is in trouble
item.description: CNN analyst Harry Enten explains recent polling that shows some historically Republican states could be more competitive leading into the 2020 presidential election, and other factors that could make President Donald Trump's reelection challenging.

item.title: Inside Brazil's cult of hydroxychloroquine
item.description: The police cavalry horses pranced through red dust towards an open grave nobody expected would be dug for Sgt. Jonas Mendonça. The 58-year-old military policeman was slightly overweight but otherwise healthy, his family says, when he got mild Covid-19 symptoms. Four days later, a fierce fever hit and he was hospitalized.

item.title: Thousands gather in Berlin to protest against Covid-19 restrictions
item.description: A large crowd of far-right groups gathered for a "sit-in" at Berlin's iconic Brandenburg Gate on Saturday to protest against the German government's coronavirus restrictions.
